The movement came at a time when the idea of secular rationalism was being ... Apparently there were two Great Awakenings but only one is defined. Links after those above are not any more informative. Apparently you think there is now a third Great Awakening, so you have to explain your thesis to get a straight answer.

Ultimately, it had to be because God granted repentance and salvation to a lot of people. We know from John 6 and Romans 9, that God is sovereign in the salvation of sinners. John 1:13 says we are born into God's family not by the will of men, but of God. In Acts, it says that as the apostles were preaching about Christ, the Lord was adding to the church daily, such as should be saved. In Romans 10:17, it concludes that faith comes by hearing, and hearing by the proclaimed word of Christ. In God's sovereign plan for saving sinners, He has chosen to impart saving faith to those He chooses, through the preaching of the gospel. The Great Awakening was a time when the gospel was being proclaimed. So I believe the reason for the Great Awakening, was that this was a time when God chose to save a lot of people, through the preaching of the gospel.
